DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to test the effect of high velocity low amplitude (HVLA) chiropractic cervical manipulation on the patient's postural control as measured by a force plate.
DOC.brief_title: The Effects of Cervical Spine Manipulation On Postural Control
DOC.criteria: Students Normal healthy adults Previous or ongoing foot, ankle, or hip problems Experiencing vertigo, visual difficulties and other disorders that would make it difficult to balance for a set period of time. Anyone with high risk for injury due to cervical manipulation Anyone with training in areas of activity that require superior balance Body mass index over 30
DOC.keyword: To determine the effects of cervical spine manipulation on postural control.
